data.description: An English-language survey of German film, one of the most influential national cinemas in the world. Consider important periods and topics such as the Weimar Republic (1918-1933); Nazism (1933-1945); post-war popular cinema; socialist East Germany; New German Cinema; and art house and international favorites of the contemporary period. Analyze how the films represent important cultural and social issues such as gender, sexuality, race/ethnicity, class, nationality, globalization, and migration.
data.title: INTRODUCTION TO GERMAN CINEMA
